newsitem.title: BRAZIL: Brazil panel approves FEF fund extension bill.
newsitem.headline: Brazil panel approves FEF fund extension bill.

text.p: A bill extending Brazil's Fiscal Stabilization Fund (FEF), which allows the government to sidestep constitutional spending rules, was approved in its first committee-level vote in Congress Wednesday.
The Constitution and Justice Committee of the Chamber of Deputies approved the bill which now advances to a special committee in the lower house.
The government wants to extend the FEF for two-and-a-half years after June 30 when an existing version of the fund is due to expire.
The FEF allows the Treasury to hold on to about $10 billion annually from funds it is constitutionally obliged to pass on to states and municipalities.

The government says it uses the FEF for social spending, avoiding the need for budget cuts or extra borrowing. Critics from opposition and government-allied parties say it gives too much power to the president and his ministers.
As a constitutional amendment, the bill requires two three-fifths majorities in each house of Congress. (( -- William Schomberg, Brasilia newsroom 5561 2230358))
